Key Arguments: The legislation does not appropriately balance freedom of expression.
The ACMA should not be the arbiter of what constitutes misinformation and disinformation.
Individuals are capable of making their own informed decisions without government intervention.
The bill could lead to censorship and suppression of free thought and expression.
There is concern about the subjective determination of what constitutes serious harm.
Main Themes: Importance of open debate and discussion
Notable Quotes: There is no freedom of expression if what we are being shown is being moderated by the ACMA.
Without the ability to put out all kinds of theories and viewpoints, there would be no discussion, no rational thought, no progress of ideas and information.
Reject this bill in its entirety and restore freedom of expression to the individual, where it should always remain.
